titleStmt.title: J. D. Campbell et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6375

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: The undersigned Citizens of Webster County would respectfully represent to your Excellincy that J E Baker a citizen of this County was fined $40 by the Webster Circuit Court at its March Term 1864 on a charge of breach of the peace that the evidence on the trial was very slight and only circumstantial and that ther were mitigating circumstances which would excuse if not justify said Baker even if guilty and we believe that his is a case in which the executive clemency would be properly exercised We would therefore most respectfully and earnestly request your Excellency to remit so much of said fine as is due the Commonwealth=
Thos E Bramlet Governor of Kentucky

J D Campbell
Richard siglar
E Skinner
J P armstrong
Joseph Dye
M C Davis
Robert ridout
Squire Womac
Geo. P. Casby
Daniel. L. Baker
C. E. Hutchison
J M Dixon
C. W. Cook
J. S. Jennings

J. K. Thomasson

J. A. Rabom
R B Virgin
G. J. Price
G C Gaines
J A Jennings
John H Bumpass
Wm C Rayburn.
James McKiney
J. N. Piland
Alen Rayburn
James. A. Rayborn
James Daniel
S D Trice
H H Smith
P D Clayton
L D Browne
R N french
W c Ramsey
A W Mooney
